comment.author: 80456351@N00
comment._content:
I love her face and her hat. 
I'd buy a bag of apples from her.

comment.author: 30484128@N03
comment._content:
Looks like an interesting lady to talk with,
and they look like fine apples.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Fossett's Circus is still going www.fossettscircus.com/ Not so the "News of the World".

comment.author: 59302818@N00
comment._content: But for the fact that it states the photo was taken in 1969 I would have dated it around 1963 because of the heading 'Christine' on the News of the World poster.  Christine Keeler was daily news in 1963.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Wrestling Spectacular must be Mick MacManus! Not the ears!

comment.author: 83480529@N04
comment._content: Photo is taken at demolished Nelsons Pillar, Hoarding is going around the stump of the Pillar 1966

comment.author: 59302818@N00
comment._content: There's a Cabaret advertised on the Hoarding for Sun 28th Sept at St Francis Xavier Hall.  28th Sept fell on a Sunday in 1969 so the original date appears to be correct.

comment.author: 47855762@N08
comment._content: HARDTOCHRISTEN is correct. It is definitely O'Connell Street (the buildings in the background may be identified today) and it is at the foot of Nelson's Pillar that was.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Another nli Wiltshire pic from 1969 has hoardings in the middle of O'Connell Street.

comment.author: 47855762@N08
comment._content: Taken on the same day I would say!  They took their time about cleaning up around the pillar - it was blown up in the March of 1966 (that's three years earlier)!

comment.author: 47855762@N08
comment._content: P.S I think she is absolutely wonderful (the subject).

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/83480529@N04] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sweir] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Thank you all! Have changed the location to O'Connell Street...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 54629463@N05
comment._content:
Can confirm corncrake68's dating.  Sunday 28th fell in 1969.
1963 would have been a Saturday
1966   "            "        "          Wednesday.

No other 28th's  on a Sunday in this decade.

PS.  Hi Sue,  Hi Jim .............  Small world  !!

comment.author: 47855762@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54629463@N05]  People power!  Deffo O'Connell street and deffo 1969. Aren't we all great detectives? (that includes you Bob!) and Hello Jim!
